channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Old Gloucester rd, near begining of Pilgrove way, 11th January
item.description:
On Old Gloucester road, 2 road lights not working, if you count from begining of Pilgrove way, its 2nd and 3rd ones.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roads need sweeping asap, 11th January
item.description:
Drains are becoming more and more blocked with silt and crumbled tarmac left by gasworks over the last few months. This resulted in road flooding issues recently after heavy rain. This problem is all the way down Gretton road in Gotherington.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30,32, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trench all way down side of kayte lane, causing tyre blowout, 11th January
item.description:
When travelling south down kayte lane, I hit a pothole which caused my tyre to blow. I had to buy a new tyre as a result of the damage. There is a trench running all the way down the left side of the road with multiple places where a blowout would be possible, I can't pinpoint exactly where it happened. The road is busy and narrow and I see that someone else had exactly the same issue in November (and I can see where a tiny fix has been made). This needs to be filled all the way down the road as I'm not the first this has happened to and I'm sure I won't be the last unless this fixed properly, rather than filling in tiny portions of it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The streetlights remain out., 11th January
item.description:
About 100 yards of road are pitch black. This has been a problem for several weeks. WHY has this not been sorted outâ€¦it is posing not only road safety issue but also is creating community safety danger for those walking these roads in the evening
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Bibury Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Rattling drain cover and broken tarmac around it, 11th January
item.description:
The drain cover is directly outside of 193 Swindon Road. It's making a terrible clunking noise every time a car drives over it. I think you are already aware of it since there's a white outline painted around it.

item.title: Traffic light red/ amber light not working, 11th January
item.description:
Traffic light on the road opposite JD gym is only showing green light. Red and amber are not working. The light controlling the exit on the same side of the road as the gym is fine, but over the road only the green works.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 11th January

Please may we enquire about requesting signage from the main road to a new veterinary practice,please see image in documents
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over 30 cans thrown in hedgerow, 11th January
item.description:
I have undertaken regular litter picking in Shaw Green Lane for many years and I have noticed in the last year that someone is regularly drinking alcohol at the quieter end of the road and throwing their cans into the hedgerow. I collected over 30 cans today, and there affre many more that I can't get to. I was wondering if some signage could go up to try and deter them, such as 'we are watching you' or a littering penalty notice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shaw Green Lane, Prestbury, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: No Waiting lines on Lypiatt Drive have faded to a point where vehicles are parking here daily. Lines have not been refreshed in over 9 years with a resident refreshing them themselves around 4 years ago. They are needed to allow reversing refuse vehicles access to the rear of Andover Terrace along Lypiatt Drive., 11th January
item.description:
Double yellow lines along Lypiatt Drive (outside "One Lypiatt") and along the rear of Andover Terrace to the point where it becomes a private road (signed and should also show on GH records). The extents of the double yellow lines can be confirmed from the TRO. These lines have never been refreshed in over 9 years despite being reported a number of times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lypiatt Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 11th January
item.description:
email rcvd 09.01.24 - Dear Sir, A few months ago, you cut down a dead tree which had been growing in the grass verge outside my house. You left a stump about three feet tall quoting 'health and safety'. I understood that you were going to grind it out. Since I keep stumbling into it in the dark, I hope that you could 'grind it out' soon. The question arises about a replacement tree. When and what sort of tree will you put there. We would NOT LIKE a Flowering Cherry out side the house for example. If we, (wife and I), have an input about a replacement tree, we would like sometyhing MORE substantial and we would LOOK AFTER IT in subsequent years,(watering), etc. When can we hope for a replacement?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 11th January
item.description:
3 potholes (not painted) in a run near the centre of the carriageway, one has caused damage to low profile tyre and customer wants to claim
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall destroyed by bin lorry in September, 11th January
item.description:
Between Star Court Fairhaven Court. I reported this in September 2023 and had an email in October 2023 saying it was resolved. Enquiry Update - Completion of Works - Enquiry 11436015, Web Reference: PAK004429. i thought I'd properly responded to this last year, but obviously I didn't, hence re raising it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Circus Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
